### Dot plot

<div class="row">

<!-- First column for large screen --> 
<div class="col-lg-6">

```{python python_code, echo=TRUE, eval=FALSE}
# import libraries
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

#load custom font
from matplotlib import rcParams
rcParams['font.family'] = 'lato'

#load and reshape the data
df = pd.read_csv('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/GDS-ODSSS/unhcr-dataviz-platform/master/data/change_over_time/dot_plot.csv')

df = df.pivot_table(index='order', columns='period', values='funding_million', sort=False)
df = df.reset_index()

ordered_df = df.sort_values(by='order')

#plot the chart
fig, ax = plt.subplots()

# The horizontal plot is made using the hline function
plt.hlines(y=ordered_df['location'], xmin=ordered_df['before_covid'], xmax=ordered_df['first_months'], color='grey', alpha=0.4)
plt.scatter(ordered_df['before_covid'], ordered_df['location'], color='skyblue', alpha=1, label='before_covid')
plt.scatter(ordered_df['first_months'], ordered_df['location'], color='green', alpha=0.4 , label='first_months')

    
#set chart title
ax.set_title('Evolution of refugee population by country of origin |2000 vs 2021', loc='left', fontweight='bold', pad=15, fontsize=14, color='#000000')

#set y-axis label
ax.set_ylabel('Number of people (millions)', color = '#666666', fontsize = 10).set_visible(True)

#set tick parameters 
ax.tick_params(axis='both', which='both', 
               labelsize=10, bottom=False, top=False, labelbottom=True, 
               left=False, right=False, labelleft=True, labelcolor = '#333333')

#remove unnecessary spines 
ax.spines['top'].set_visible(False)
ax.spines['right'].set_visible(False)
ax.spines['left'].set_visible(False)

#show grid below the bars
ax.grid(axis='y', lw=.5, c='k', alpha=.3)
ax.set_axisbelow(True)

#format x-axis tick labels
def number_formatter(x, pos):
    if x >= 1e6:
        s = '{:1.0f}M'.format(x*1e-6)
    elif x < 1e6 and x > 0:
        s = '{:1.0f}K'.format(x*1e-3)
    else: 
        s = '{:1.0f}'.format(x)
    return s
ax.yaxis.set_major_formatter(number_formatter)

#set chart source and copyright
plt.annotate('Source: UNHCR Refugee Data Finder', (0,0), (0, -25), xycoords='axes fraction', textcoords='offset points', va='top', color = '#666666', fontsize=9)
plt.annotate('©UNHCR, The UN Refugee Agency', (0,0), (0, -35), xycoords='axes fraction', textcoords='offset points', va='top', color = '#666666', fontsize=9)

#adjust chart margin and layout
fig.tight_layout()
plt.margins(x=0.02, y=0.1)

#show chart
plt.show()
```

```{python python_slope_chart, echo=FALSE, out.width="100%", fig.height=5.75}
# import libraries
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
from textwrap import wrap

#load custom font
from matplotlib import rcParams
rcParams['font.family'] = 'lato'

#load and reshape the data
df = pd.read_csv('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/GDS-ODSSS/unhcr-dataviz-platform/master/data/change_over_time/dot_plot.csv')

df = df.pivot_table(index=['location','order'], columns='period', values='percent', sort=False)
df = df.reset_index()

ordered_df = df.sort_values(by='order', ascending=False)

y_labels = ordered_df['location']
y_labels = [ '\n'.join(wrap(l, 20)) for l in y_labels ]

#plot the chart
fig, ax = plt.subplots()

# The horizontal plot is made using the hline function
plt.scatter(ordered_df['before_covid'], ordered_df['location'], color='#8EBEFF', label='before_covid')
plt.scatter(ordered_df['first_months'], ordered_df['location'], color='#0072BC', label='first_months')
plt.hlines(y=ordered_df['location'], xmin=ordered_df['before_covid'], xmax=ordered_df['first_months'], color='#666666')

#plt.yticks()

#set chart legend
ax.legend(labels = ["Before COVID-19", "First month of the crisis"], loc=(0,0.98), ncol=2, frameon=False, fontsize=10, labelcolor='#333333',handlelength=0.7, borderpad=0, handletextpad=0.5)

    
#set chart title
ax.set_title('COVID-19 impact on poverty rates of informal workers', loc='left', fontweight='bold', pad=25, fontsize=14, color='#000000')

#set tick parameters 
ax.tick_params(axis='both', which='both', 
               labelsize=10, bottom=False, top=False, labelbottom=True, 
               left=False, right=False, labelleft=True, labelcolor = '#333333')

#remove unnecessary spines 
ax.spines['top'].set_visible(False)
ax.spines['right'].set_visible(False)
ax.spines['left'].set_visible(False)

#show grid below the bars
ax.grid(axis='y', lw=.5, c='k', alpha=.3)
ax.set_axisbelow(True)


#set chart source and copyright
plt.annotate('Source: UNHCR Refugee Data Finder', (0,0), (0, -25), xycoords='axes fraction', textcoords='offset points', va='top', color = '#666666', fontsize=9)
plt.annotate('©UNHCR, The UN Refugee Agency', (0,0), (0, -35), xycoords='axes fraction', textcoords='offset points', va='top', color = '#666666', fontsize=9)

#adjust chart margin and layout
fig.tight_layout()
plt.margins(x=0.02, y=0.1)

#show chart
plt.show()
```
